reasoning: Reporting incidence of early-onset sarcoidosis (pediatric/young adult). Overall sarcoidosis incidence is 10-20 per 100k in high-incidence populations; early-onset represents approximately 10-15% of cases, estimated at 1-2 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological data for early-onset subtype.
source: Henke CE et al. (1986). The epidemiology of sarcoidosis in Rochester, Minnesota: a population-based study. Am J Epidemiol. 123(5):840-845
